title: Why is education free until university? - Quora

response.answer_text: </start rant> I agree with sentiments here. Why should EVERYONE’s taxes go up for the select adults that go to college? Those that choose alternate routes get punished? What if you graduated from college, you have to pay a graduate tax? A tax that because you graduated you have to pay more to the state irrespective of the job you hold? Back in my Grandpa’s day people typically stopped at 8th grade and were able to perform their duties until retirement. My question is what has dramatically changed? Technology? Kids these days run computers and technology much better than their parents do. I think having an Bachelor’s to get into an administrative assistant job is OVERKILL. Also, associate’s degrees are considered extended high school. Where are the middle-skills? So my other question is: Why the BA/BS? Why is 4-years the magical amount of time to be competent? Lastly, it’s a slippery slope. If high school couldn’t teach the skills needed, how does college change that? Employers are saying college grads are lacking now…. Soon a Master’s for janitorial work? I think we need to re-haul the structure. My proposal? Bring back the high school diploma (bring it back to a status of envy)… if tax money is spent on that, we aren’t getting our money’s worth because we have to go to college and pay that too. Why isn’t the high school diploma “valued”? It’s beyond me. It opens up about a quarter of jobs, non-HS-grads get… We graduate almost 90% of high schoolers… That shouldn’t be the case… it’s way too easy to graduate. They are basically handing out diplomas. </end rant>

It was considered at the time that a high school education was the knowledge level needed for a person to obtain a sufficiently well paying job to Become self supporting. Of course, at the time, high school was still focused on teaching a competent level of reading, writing, mathematics, and knowledge of history, geography, literature, science, and civics, and a basic level of critical thinking. Not any more. That was before Leftist politicians dumbed down the curriculum so that illegal aliens who don’t even speak English can graduate, and as a result high schools now graduate children so illiterate that some cannot even read their own diplomas. The business world has long realized that a high school education no longer means proficiency in basic mathematics, or literacy in English, or a correct understanding of American history or Civics. But the children are now extremely well indoctrinated in Identity Politics, Leftist ideology, love of Socialism, and attitudes that everything they don’t like is racist, and that protesting gets them anything they want. They have no critical thinking skills, but are conditioned to get their beliefs and attitudes from social media not factual learning, and “Cancel Culture” is their automatic response to anyone who expresses ideas they have been told are not “politically correct”. Unfortunately, all this makes them very poor candidates for employment in most businesses, especially small businesses that value initiative, reliability, diligence, problem solving, diplomacy, and basic reading and mathematics. Kids at cashier stations cannot even make change without the register telling them the right amount. Compared to students a few decades ago, they are generally far less educated but far more indoctrinated. That is what “free secondary education“, under government control, has created. Higher education is suffering similar politicization and deterioration. Courses like “Western Civilization” and genuine American History are being discarded in favor of useless or outright racist courses in “Critical Race Theory” or “White Privilege”, and degrees are being conferred in contrived, useless “majors” like “Gender Studies” or “Lesbian Dance Theory”. Millions of graduates now find themselves unqualified for any employment more demanding than flipping burgers, while burdened with tens or even hundreds of thousands of dollars of school loans. Making this dumbed down college experience “free” would do nothing to restore the quality of higher education or add an iota of critical thinking to the curriculum, but would shift a massive burden of hundreds of billions of largely wasted money directly onto taxpayers who do not deserve to be punished for the debacle of greed, racism, and miseducation being inflicted on millions of our young people by Leftist ideologues in academia. Not everyone is academically capable of succeeding at college even at these dumbed down levels. 40% of entrants to four year colleges fail to graduate even after six years running up student debt, and businesses have likewise clearly rejected many college degrees as useless for employment. It would be a disaster to suggest that anyone has a right to go to college for free, and shuck the cost onto taxpayers. Even in European countries that are often raised as examples, what they do and the limited availability, high testing standards, and austere “college exoerience” is not at all what Americans have come to expect or accept, even if it were supposedly “free”.
